reviews.text: So so so so good! The food is amazing and a really good value too. One another amazing thing about it are the people working there. It's always so busy, but the team never looks flustered or overwhelmed. The tacos are always so nicely prepared and they never make you feel in rush when you order. Extremely efficient and super friendly. Love it!

Really great taco spot - might be my new fave! A little on the expensive side but expected from the location. I had the beef, pork and chicken tacos - wow. The meat is so tender, so tasty and has a perfect level of spice. Can‚Äôt go to borough market and not visit this place - you won‚Äôt regret it.

Really good tacos,
Sauces were actually spicy üå∂ which added the proper experience for a Mexican food place.
Food was ready in no time, luckily because we were starving üòÜ.
Its a good option in between all the different food styles you can find inside Borough Market

Recommended! üëçüèΩ
Surprisingly delicious. There was a line so I thought, hey why not give it a try. I had the lamb, chicken and beef tacos. Flavourful, juicy and filling. Great combination flavours.

As a Mexican, very dissapointed. Excepting by the birria (lamb), tacos don't taste as they should (specially the cochinita). They should change the name of each taco, otherwise this feels like cultural appropriation. I knew it was a bad signal that the cooks were not even latins, no offense, but there's no way a stranger knows exactly how original mexican food is supposed to taste.
*Disclaimer: I see many foreigners giving 5 stars, I give it 1 not because the food was awful, but because I as foreigner in London, I looks for good tacos, in mexican standards. Otherwise, I would go to taco bell, chipotle or any of those tasty but fake mexican places.

Food is banging, especially the fried chicken, ox's heart and chilli sauce.  It's best to treat this place as an expensive tapas bar and order a load of dishes to share with a group.  My only gripe is that after ¬£17 on food or just me, I was still hungry.  Whilst quality is 100% there, value for money is around 75%.  That being said, they get 5 stars because the service was fantastic, friendly, quick and the place had its own unique vibe.  Definitely go again!

Delicious pillows of heaven. We had the beef, the chicken and the pork (classic) and all were as equally nice but very different flavours each time which was a nice surprise. More filling than expected, we were both stuffed after 2 each.
The bao buns are so delicious. Fried chicken was great too, and the rice. Good you can book a table. Buzzing on a Friday night!
The steak with rice was pretty good but a bit too salty. The lines were very long, even with their takeout bao window. The service was not very smooth nor polite.
I had fried chicken take away. Th taste was as expected. But the portion was rather small.
Hats off to the chef Kat, what a lovely lunch üòç Babs at customer service was so pleasant also. Overall a great experience. 100% will recommend this spot. üëçüèº
One of best place I've eaten in a while with an amazing chef. I can not to visit again. Thank you Kat for the food.
Phenomenal food, phenomenal service. It really tasted like every single ingredient was put in intentionally and thus every component was absolutely beautiful.
Always coming back to Borough Market for the Dosa Chaat! Easy but excellent food - every bite is a festival of flavours. Lovely staff serves a great experience.

Last week, I went to Horn OK Please, and had amazing service from Kat. Bubbly, welcoming and friendly! She really made me want to come back.

Will definitely be back again!
